<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 170, 293]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 297, 392, 313]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 AS Level Structured Questions  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 338, 415, 354]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 366, 374]]<|/det|>
No Additional Materials are required.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 386, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 490]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. Write in dark blue or black pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 500, 255, 516]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 526, 764, 558]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used. You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 567, 760, 597]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 73, 126, 88]]<|/det|>
## Data  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 103, 668, 560]]<|/det|>
speed of light in free space \(c = 3.00\times 10^{8}\mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\) permeability of free space \(\mu_{0} = 4\pi \times 10^{- 7}\mathrm{Hm}^{- 1}\) permittivity of free space \(\epsilon_{0} = 8.85\times 10^{- 12}\mathrm{Fm}^{- 1}\) \((\frac{1}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}} = 8.99\times 10^{9}\mathrm{mF}^{- 1})\) elementary charge \(e = 1.60\times 10^{- 19}\mathrm{C}\) the Planck constant \(h = 6.63\times 10^{- 34}\mathrm{Js}\) unified atomic mass unit \(1u = 1.66\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of electron \(m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11\times 10^{- 31}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of proton \(m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) molar gas constant \(R = 8.31\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Avogadro constant \(N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02\times 10^{23}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Boltzmann constant \(k = 1.38\times 10^{- 23}\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\) gravitational constant \(G = 6.67\times 10^{- 11}\mathrm{Nm}^{2}\mathrm{kg}^{- 2}\) acceleration of free fall \(g = 9.81\mathrm{m s}^{- 2}\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 107, 561, 144]]<|/det|>
\[s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^{2}\] \[\nu^{2} = u^{2} + 2as\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 163, 527, 180]]<|/det|>
\[W = p\Delta V\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 194, 537, 223]]<|/det|>
\[\phi = -\frac{Gm}{r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 235, 522, 252]]<|/det|>
\[p = \rho gh\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 263, 562, 294]]<|/det|>
\[p = \frac{1}{3}\frac{Nm}{V}\langle c^2\rangle\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 305, 536, 322]]<|/det|>
\[a = -\omega^2 x\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 339, 616, 375]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = \nu_0\cos \omega t\] \[\nu = \pm \omega \sqrt{(\chi_0^2 - x^2)}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 384, 536, 420]]<|/det|>
\[f_0 = \frac{f_s\nu}{\nu\pm\nu_s}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 430, 537, 465]]<|/det|>
\[V = \frac{Q}{4\pi\epsilon_0r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 472, 628, 490]]<|/det|>
\[1 / C = 1 / C_1 + 1 / C_2 + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 503, 596, 522]]<|/det|>
\[C = C_1 + C_2 + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 533, 527, 560]]<|/det|>
\[W = \frac{1}{2} QV\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 574, 532, 591]]<|/det|>
\[I = A n v q\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 607, 596, 625]]<|/det|>
\[R = R_{1} + R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 640, 628, 658]]<|/det|>
\[1 / R = 1 / R_{1} + 1 / R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 670, 517, 704]]<|/det|>
\[V_{\mathrm{H}} = \frac{BI}{ntq}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 718, 559, 736]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\sin \omega t\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 752, 579, 770]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\exp (-\lambda t)\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 780, 536, 814]]<|/det|>
\[\lambda = \frac{0.693}{t_{\frac{1}{2}}}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[297, 72, 700, 89]]<|/det|>

<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 146, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 470, 120]]<|/det|>
Determine the SI base units of stress.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 118, 321, 135]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[494, 246, 920, 264]]<|/det|>

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 277, 920, 310]]<|/det|>
A beam PQ is clamped so that the beam is horizontal. A mass \(M\) of \(500 \text{g}\) is hung from end Q and the beam bends slightly, as illustrated in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 317, 838, 428]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 441, 532, 460]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 473, 920, 522]]<|/det|>
The length \(l\) of the beam from the edge of the clamp R to end Q is \(60.0 \text{cm}\). The width \(b\) of the beam is \(30.0 \text{mm}\) and the thickness \(d\) of the beam is \(5.00 \text{mm}\). The material of the beam has Young modulus \(E\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 535, 878, 553]]<|/det|>
The mass \(M\) is made to oscillate vertically. The time period \(T\) of the oscillations is \(0.58 \text{s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 566, 484, 584]]<|/det|>
The period \(T\) is given by the expression

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 588, 569, 623]]<|/det|>
\[T = 2\pi \sqrt{\frac{4M l^3}{Ebd^3}}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 629, 183, 648]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 628, 368, 647]]<|/det|>
Determine \(E\) in GPa.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 875, 920, 893]]<|/det|>
<form>E = ....................................................GPa [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 72, 181, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 72, 918, 89]]<|/det|>
The quantities used to determine \(E\) should be measured with accuracy and with precision.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 102, 685, 121]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A cylinder is made from a material of density \(2.7 \text{g} \text{cm}^{- 3}\). The cylinder has diameter \(2.4 \text{cm}\) and length \(5.0 \text{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 497, 135]]<|/det|>

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 339, 880, 359]]<|/det|>
The cylinder in **(a)** is hung from the end A of a non-uniform bar AB, as shown in Fig. 3.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 368, 836, 536]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 551, 532, 570]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 581, 920, 615]]<|/det|>
The bar has length \(50\mathrm{cm}\) and has weight \(0.25\mathrm{N}\). The centre of gravity of the bar is \(20\mathrm{cm}\) from B. The bar is pivoted at P. The pivot is \(12\mathrm{cm}\) from B.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 628, 920, 662]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 195, 920, 228]]<|/det|>
One end of a string is attached to a vibrator. The string is stretched by passing the other end over a pulley and attaching a load, as illustrated in Fig. 4.1.

The frequency of vibration of the vibrator is adjusted to \(250\mathrm{Hz}\) and a transverse wave travels along the string with a speed of \(12\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\). The wave is reflected at the pulley and a stationary wave forms on the string.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 472, 670, 491]]<|/det|>
Fig. 4.2 shows the string between points A and B at time \(t = t_1\).

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 497, 814, 644]]<|/det|>

At time \(t = t_1\) the string has maximum displacement.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 722, 415, 740]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[494, 845, 920, 863]]<|/det|>

\(t = t_1 + 2.0 \text{ms}\) (label this line P),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 133, 210, 152]]<|/det|>

<label>(a)</label>
